title: Active learning of neural response functions with Gaussian processes

author: Mijung Park, University of Texas at Austin

segmentation: Fundamental problem in neuroscience is to understand how spike responses convey information about sensory stimuli.

One approach is to build an explicit encoding model which describes the probabilistic mapping from simulate to spike trains or popular framework describes this mapping in terms of cascade over stages.
First, the linear dimensionality reduction using a Bank of filters.
Second nonlinear function that combines filter outputs and 3rd a stochastic history dependent spiking process.
While most work has focused on the problem of estimating the linear states in this model.

We addressed the neural response nonlinearity, this intermediate stage, which I will I will refer to as F. Specifically, we use our Gaussian process prior to obtain a flexible nonparametric model of F. We then formulate an active learning procedure for selecting stimuli in a closed loop experiment, allowing us to learn F with a minimal amount of experimental data.
